content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully deployed on the map. The agent repeatedly attempted to work with a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) for supplying Automation Science Packs, but all placement and crafting operations failed due to a lack of lab inventory and missing sub-ingredients. Although operations involved retrieving furnace entities at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) for iron smelting and at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) for copper smelting, these interactions were part of resource‐processing procedures and did not result in any newly created, persistent structures.

ERROR TIPS
• API Usage Errors  
 – When calling get_entities, provide exactly the parameters expected by the function. Avoid using unexpected keywords like “radius” or supplying extra positional arguments.  
 – Ensure that any function expected to return an iterable is validated so that a “NoneType” is not mistakenly iterated over.

• Lab Crafting and Placement Failures  
 – Verify that the required Lab item is present in inventory before attempting placement.  
 – Before initiating Lab crafting, check that all necessary sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are sufficiently available.  
 – Confirm that prerequisite processes (like smelting to produce essential plates) have fully completed to support sub-component production.

• Resource Shortages During Crafting  
 – Monitor inventory levels closely and adjust smelting or resource conversion processes to prevent shortages that ultimately block lab crafting.
